net

Interface PlayerFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RandomPlayerFactory

    public interface PlayerFactory
    A PlayerFactory is used by the local Scotland Yard game to create the required players and spectators for that local game. The game will create players from this factory as required.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void finish()
      The finish() method will be called when the game is over.
      java.util.List<Spectator> getSpectators(ScotlandYardView view)
      A factory can also produce a number of Spectators for a game.
      Player player(Colour colour, ScotlandYardView view, java.lang.String mapFilename)
      The player() method creates a new player that can play with the given colour, view and mapFilename.
      void ready()
      The ready() method will be called by the game when all of the players (both local and remote) have joined.

    • Method Detail

      • player

        Player player(Colour colour,
              ScotlandYardView view,
              java.lang.String mapFilename)
        The player() method creates a new player that can play with the given colour, view and mapFilename.
        Parameters:
        colour - the colour of the player.
        view - the ScotlandYardView that provides game information.
        mapFilename - the name of the file that is being played.
        Returns:
        the Player that will play the given colour.

      • getSpectators

        java.util.List<Spectator> getSpectators(ScotlandYardView view)
        A factory can also produce a number of Spectators for a game. These will normally be used for GUIs to spectate the game, or for AIs that want to be notified when moves have bee made.
        Parameters:
        view - the ScotlandYardView that provides game information.
        Returns:
        the list of all spectators that should be subscribed.

      • ready

        void ready()
        The ready() method will be called by the game when all of the players (both local and remote) have joined. If you need code to be executed after all players are joined, this is where it goes.

      • finish

        void finish()
        The finish() method will be called when the game is over. This is where you put code that does any clean-up you might require.
